Column Comment.0: EQUIPMENT IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for a specific peice of equipment.
Column Comment.1: EQUIPMENT PART IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for a peice of equipment that isnow part of a composite peice of equipment that is used as an whole. Over time,parts of the whole object may be replaced, repaired or reconfigured.
Column Comment.2: EQUIPMENT CROSS REFERENCE OBSERVATION NUMBER: A unique primarykey component added so that composite equipment may capture relationshipsbetween specific components more than once over a life time. For example, a rigmay be comprised of many parts, some of which are in service from time to time.
Column Comment.3: ACTIVE INDICATOR: A Y/N flag indicating whether this row of data is currently eitheractive / valid (Y) or inactive / invalid (N).
Column Comment.4: COMMISSION DATE: The date when this peice of equipment was commissioned asa part of this composite.
Column Comment.5: DECOMMISSION DATE: The date when this peice of equipment wasdecommissioned as a part of this composite.
Column Comment.6: DESCRIPTION: a textual description of the equipment.
Column Comment.7: EFFECTIVE DATE: the date on which this row of data first came into effect from abusiness perspective.
Column Comment.8: EQUIPMENT CROSS REFERENCE TYPE: the type of relationship between twopieces of equipment, often indicating one piece that can or has replaced another.May also be used to indicate equipment that has the same function, and aretherefore equivalent. May be used to indicate the installation of one piece ofequipment with or in another.
Column Comment.9: EXPIRY DATE: the date on which this row of data is no longer in effect from abusiness perspective.
Column Comment.10: INTERCHANGABLE IND: A Y/N flag indicating whether this part can be interchangedwith another part once installed. Y indicates the part can be removed and exchangedwith another part. N indicates that it cannot be removed or exchanged with anotherpart.
Column Comment.11: ROW_MANAGEMENT_GUID: This value may be used to provide a global uniqueidentifier for this row of data. Use of this column is not mandatory, but if used,optional PPDM NOT NULL and UNIQUE INDEX constraints provided in the datamodel DDL should be created.
Column Comment.12: REMARK: Narrative remarks about this row of data.
Column Comment.13: SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agency designated as thesource of information for this row.
Column Comment.14: ROW CHANGED BY: Application login id of the user who last changed the row.
Column Comment.15: ROW CHANGED DATE: System date of the last time the row was changed.
Column Comment.16: ROW CREATED BY: System user who created this row of data.
Column Comment.17: ROW CREATED DATE: Date that the row was created on.
Column Comment.18: ROW_EFFECTIVE_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of datais effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row of data wasmade available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.19: ROW_EXPIRY_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of data isno longer effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row ofdata was no longer available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.20: PPDM ROW QUALITY: A set of values indicating the quality of data in this row,usually with reference to the method or procedures used to load the data, althoughother types of quality reference are permitted.
